channel.title: India News, India News Live and Breaking News Today | Hindustan Times
channel.description: India News - Find Latest India News and Breaking News today from India on Politics, Business, Entertainment, Technology, Sports, Lifestyle and more at Hindustan Times.
channel.copyright: Copyright (C) 2019 HT Media Limited. All Rights Reserved.

image.title: India News, India News Live and Breaking News Today | Hindustan Times

item.title: NSA Doval led secret back-channels talks with Pak for months before DGMO pact
item.description: rrThe first sign that India-Pakistan back-channel conversations were on track came earlier this month when Pak army chief Gen Bajwa said it was time to extend a hand of peace in all directionsrr

item.title: 'Living together as partners not same as Indian family unit': Centre opposes same sex marriage in Delhi HC
item.description: The Centre on Thursday said in the Delhi high court that living together as partners and having sexual relationship by same sex couple not comparable with Indian family unit.

item.title: India's healthcare workers balk at taking homegrown Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: rrIndia has vaccinated more than 10.5 million health and front-line workers since beginning its immunisation campaign on Jan. 16. But only 1.2 million, or about 11%, of them have taken COVAXIN, the locally developed vaccine from Bharat Biotech.rr

item.title: 'Needed level playing field': Govt announces new online media rules
item.description: rrAs per the new guidelines, social media platforms are required to disclose the first originator of mischievous tweet or message, the information and technology minister announced.rr

item.title: Janata curfew, weekend lockdown: Maha districts impose curbs amid Covid spike
item.description: The district administration in Latur has decided to implement 'Janata curfew' on February 27 and 28 in view of the rising cases of coronavirus in the state.

item.title: 2nd edition of Khelo India Winter Games begins in Gulmarg from Friday
item.description: rrThe games in Gulmarg will see participation of 1200 athletes from 27 states and Union Territories (UTs) besides the armed forces personnel.rr

item.title: Chhattisgarh: Allegations cloud alleged suicide of surrendered woman ‘Maoist’
item.description: rrDantewada SP rubbished the allegations saying the deceased surrendered in front of the media and her interrogation report and statements of other Maoists showed clearly that she was working as a CNM member.rr

item.title: LPG gets costlier by r₹r25, one cylinder to cost r₹r794 in Delhi
item.description: This rise in the prices of the LPG gas cylinders comes for the third time this month.

item.title: Covid-19 samples from 8 Maharashtra districts sent for testing of new mutations
item.description: The transmission of cases has increased rapidly in some districts of the Vidarbha region. Districts such as Amravati have been reporting over 20 per cent positivity rate in the last few days.

item.title: MSME sector emerges as growth engine of economy, says RBI Governor
item.description: Das called for increasing digital payment and digital penetration across the country.

item.title: Armies of India, Pakistan agree to ceasefire along LoC from Feb 24 midnight
item.description: The move comes at a time when the Indian military is largely focused on the standoff with China in Ladakh sector of the Line of Actual Control (LAC), which emerged in the open in May last year

item.title: India, Pakistan agree to ceasefire along LoC at DGMO meet
item.description: rrThe meeting which was held between the Director Generals of Military Operations of India and Pakistan also reviewed the current situation across the Line of Control (LoC) and other sectors ‘in a free, frank and cordial atmosphere’, the statement said.rr

item.title: News updates in HT: 229 students test positive for Covid-19 in Maharashtra and all the latest news
item.description: rrHere are today’s top news, analysis, and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.rr

item.title: Covid-19 spike: Mumbai's Oval Maidan to be closed from Feb 26
item.description: The Oval Maidan, where cricket and football matches are frequently played, witnesses crowds of sport enthusiasts during weekends.

item.title: Fashion forward: Parliament staff get great deals on clothes, accessories
item.description: The secretariat has put out a circular listing as many as 50 items available for sale—fabric for shirts, trousers, suits, uniforms for marshals of the House, neckties, even leather gloves and jackets

item.title: Transport strike in Tamil Nadu today, 80% bus services hit
item.description: The strike by the transport unions has been reported to involve over one lakh transport employees affecting over 80 per cent of the bus services.

item.title: Chinese infra push across Sikkim, Arunachal border raises a red flag in Delhi
item.description: rrChina has been carrying out rapid military-infra upgrade across the Upper Subansiri district in Arunachal Pradesh including at least three new bridges, troop sheds and a new 66-kilometre roadrr

item.title: Toolkit case: Shantanu Muluk gets interim protection from arrest till March 9
item.description: Additional sessions judge Dharmendar Rana on Thursday directed that no coercive action shall be taken against Muluk till the said date, when the hearing will next take place.

item.title: Petrol costs r₹r90.93, diesel r₹r81.32 in Delhi. Check fuel prices in different states
item.description: Here is how much petrol and diesel cost as of Thursday in different cities of India.

item.title: 3 factors behind Covid-19 spike: What Maharashtra state health official says
item.description: The concentrated spurt of Vidarbha region is gradually spreading to other areas of Maharashtra, including Pune and Mumbai.

item.title: India, Bangladesh to start bi-weekly passenger train from March 26
item.description: The non-stop passenger train with ten bogeys, running between New Jalpaiguri and Dhaka, will cover a distance of 513 km. This will also be the third passenger train between the two countries

item.title: PM Modi in Puducherry & Tamil Nadu today, to inaugurate key projects
item.description: According to the itinerary, PM Modi will arrive in Puducherry in the first half of the day, at around 11.30am, and, later, in Tamil Nadu’s Coimbatore at around 4.30pm

item.title: Daily Covid-19 infections rise to 16,738, highest since January 29
item.description: The number of daily fatalities too rose with 138 deaths recorded in the last 24 hours.

item.title: Bharat Bandh on Feb 26: Commercial markets to remain shut tomorrow
item.description: As a transporter body has supported the strike on the issue of fuel price hike, E-way bill rules, 40 lakh trucks will remain off the road on Friday.

item.title: Tests on kids: Expert panel asks Bharat Biotech to submit Covaxin efficacy data first
item.description: Covaxin is already approved for use in India for adults in a clinical trial mode based on the safety and immunogenicity data the company submitted

item.title: Sensex gains over 500 points in opening session; Nifty at 15,151.15
item.description: rrOn Wednesday, Indian equities closed sharply higher after trading was halted on the NSE for nearly four hours due to a technical issue.rr

item.title: Soldier arrested in J&K’s Udhampur for passing on classified data to Pakistan
item.description: The people said the soldier’s identity was being withheld as a probe in the case is underway. He is from an infantry regiment posted at the army’s Northern Command headquarters in Udhampur

item.title: UK court to decide on Nirav Modi’s extradition today: Case so far
item.description: Nirav Modi is accused of fraudulently obtaining letters of undertaking or loan agreements and laundering the proceeds of that fraud. He also faces charges of “causing the disappearance of evidence” and intimidating witnesses

item.title: News updates in HT: CSE study shows 8 out 10 most polluted cities in NCR, UP and all the latest news
item.description: rrHere are today’s top news, analysis, and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.rr

item.title: Vaccine for 60+ & above 45 with co-morbidities from March 1: Key points
item.description: This is the first time the private sector will be actively involved in administering vaccines, and doses will be available to eligible people who are willing to pay

item.title: 'No lockdown': Shivraj Singh Chouhan assures workers amid Covid-19 spike
item.description: Workers should not migrate to other states fearing lockdown, Madhya Pradesh CM has said.

item.title: LIVE: Maharashtra's Thane records 614 new cases
item.description: The United States has the highest Covid-19 tally globally, as well as related death toll. India and Brazil have the next highest caseloads, while Brazil and Mexico follow the US in terms of deaths.

item.title: Most of northwest India sees summer-like temperatures
item.description: Under the influence of a feeble western disturbance, fairly widespread rainfall/snowfall is likely over Jammu, Kashmir, Ladakh, Gilgit, Baltistan and Muzaffarabad during the next five days

item.title: Nagaland cuts taxes on petrol and diesel, fuel prices come down
item.description: rrPetrol and Diesel were being retailed at r₹r90.41 and r₹r83.99 in Kohima on Wednesday. rr

item.title: Farm laws protests: Govt should not delay addressing farmers' demand, says BSP
item.description: rrProtests enter Day 90. Tikait says 40 lakh tractors will hit the streets.rr

item.title: Vaccination for senior citizens, and 45+ with co-morbidities: How to register
item.description: A new version of the Co-WIN app will be launched soon where the option of self-registration will be there. Common service centres may also open windows to register people for 2nd phase vaccination.

item.title: In video message, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal thanks voters in Surat
item.description: “Gujarat has introduced a phase of new politics, which is politics of honesty, politics of work, politics of improved schools and hospitals, and politics of 24x7 free electricity,” said Kejriwal.

item.title: RSS worker stabbed to death in Kerala during SDPI rally
item.description: rrPolice presence in Wayalar has been increased in the district in the wake of the violence.rr

item.title: ‘Differences will arise if laws are steamrolled’: Mallikarjun Kharge
item.description: "The foremost requirement in the role I played was to be a strong Opposition voice on matters that impacted the people, especially the poor, the farmers, and the working class. They (the treasury benches) would insult us by pointing to our numerical weakness," Kharge said

item.title: Citing poor infra, SC seeks legislative impact study on consumer law
item.description: A Supreme Court bench, headed by justice Sanjay Kishan Kaul, directed the government to place the said study before the court to indicate if social, economic and institutional impacts were taken into account prior to replacing the 1986 consumer protection law with the 2019 law.

item.title: Assam declared ‘disturbed area’ for six months
item.description: The fresh order is an extension of a similar move on August 28 last year, when the state was declared a ‘Disturbed Area’ for six months. There is no official comment yet on the reason behind the extension.

item.title: Punjab ‘shamelessly’ backing Mukhtar Ansari: UP govt in Supreme Court
item.description: When the apex court took up the petition by the UP government seeking Ansari’s transfer out of Punjab, an adjournment request was made by senior advocate Dushyant Dave appearing for the Punjab government.

item.title: Hyderabad teen who made ‘false’ rape bid claim dies by suicide: Police
item.description: A case of suspicious death has been registered and an investigation is on. Family members told police that it was her second attempt to kill herself in the past 24 hours, according to a police official who did not want to be named.

item.title: Long way to go for full LAC de-escalation: Army chief General Naravane
item.description: Naravane’s comments came four days after Indian and Chinese generals held talks in eastern Ladakh and agreed to resolve outstanding issues at friction points on the LAC in a “steady and orderly” manner and were unanimous that last week’s Pangong Tso disengagement provided “a good basis” for resolving pending problems.

item.title: No extra chance for taking UPSC exam: Supreme Court
item.description: In a February 5 hearing, the government offered candidates who have exhausted their chances an extra one, as a concession, but the court advised it against this, although it said the government is free to exercise its discretion in addressing the grievances of the petitioners.

item.title: Paid shots from March 1 as India expands Covid-19 vaccine drive
item.description: The decision marks a significant opening up of the vaccination drive, with the roll-out for the general public being moved up from the previously estimated window of mid-March, and comes at a time when the country is on the brink of a second wave of infections.

item.title: Govt rules for online media to include takedown power
item.description: Digital media, as defined in a document that lays out the government’s framework to regulate online content, will cover digitised content that can be transmitted over the internet or computer networks.

item.title: ‘Patron of terror’: India hits out at Pakistan at United Nations
item.description: India’s “right of reply” to the Pakistani minister’s speech was delivered by Seema Pujani, second secretary in the permanent mission to the UN. She described Pakistan’s continued misuse of various platforms for “baseless and malicious propaganda against India is not new”.

item.title: 2020-21 likely to see record paddy procurement
item.description: Paddy is the main summer staple that drives the incomes of millions of farmers. The ministry’s official figures show the government’s total procurement of summer paddy has touched 65.8 million tonnes until January 22 against the purchase of 56.5 million tonnes in the corresponding part of last year.

item.title: Union Cabinet approves L-G proposal for President’s rule in Puducherry
item.description: L-G Tamilisai Soundararajan recommended imposition of President’s Rule in Puducherry after the opposition Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and its allies did not stake claim to form the government

item.title: BJP, Congress trade barbs over Motera stadium renaming
item.description: At a cabinet briefing, union ministers Prakash Javadekar and Ravi Shankar Prasad also hit out at the Congress and wondered if the top Congress leaders such as Sonia or Rahul Gandhi have even bothered to visit the world’s tallest statue, that of Sardar Patel, at Kevadiya in Gujarat.

item.title: Facebook now says it’s not obligated to appear before Parliamentary panels
item.description: The exchange and Facebook’s contention that it could choose not to appear before any institution, as long as it follows the laws, is interesting because it comes at a time when the Union government is readying a framework to regulate social media and digital media companies.

item.title: Toolkit case: Shantanu Muluk’s bail plea hearing today
item.description: Additional sessions judge Dharmender Rana, who granted bail to Ravi on Tuesday, posted Muluk’s bail application for arguments on Thursday. Muluk had got transit bail from the Bombay high court on February 16 for a period of 10 days.

item.title: CBI names TMC youth leader in charge-sheet of cattle smuggling case
item.description: rrEarlier this month, CBI in the first charge-sheet in the case had named BSF Commandant Satish Kumar and Murshidabad-based businessman Enamul Haque along with five others for their alleged involvement in cattle smuggling across the India-Bangladesh border.rr

item.title: Top court proposes cadre of magistrates to fill gaps in police investigation
item.description: rrThe bench, also comprising Justices L Nageswara Rao and S Ravindra Bhat apart from Chief Justice of India (CJI) SA Bobde were of the view that magistrates should play a more “intrusive” role in investigation.rr

item.title: College student in Andhra Pradesh killed for rejecting marriage proposal
item.description: rrPolice said the accused and the victim were in a relationship for a year, but of late she had been avoiding him.rr

item.title: Higher fares for short distance trains to discourage needless travel: Railways
item.description: rrThe national carrier at present is operating only special passenger trains since the curbs on lockdown were eased. Regular passenger trains have been suspended since March 25, 2020.rr

item.title: New Covid-19 strains not more infectious, need to aggressively monitor situation: AIIMS Director Randeep Guleria
item.description: "Currently we have vaccines with efficacy of 70 per cent , 80 per cent, 90 per cent so even if there is slight fall in efficacy they will still be effective in preventing the virus from further spreading," Guleria told in an interview to ANI.

item.title: 2 security personnel killed in Chhattisgarh’s Narayanpur in Maoist attacks
item.description: rrBoth the casualties took place due to IED blasts.rr

item.title: No question of renaming, Gujarat deputy CM clarifies on Motera stadium being named after PM Modi
item.description: Narendra Modi Stadium in Motera, inaugurated by President Ram Nath Kovind, is part of a larger complex, named 'Sardar Patel Sports Complex'.

item.title: India plans new social media controls after Twitter face-off
item.description: The latest draft rules say companies should remove the content as early as possible, but no later than 36 hours, after a government or legal order.

item.title: Differences in Meghalaya BJP intensifies, coalition govt comes under strain
item.description: rrThe BJP unit has also been at loggerheads with the ruling Meghalaya Democratic Alliance (MDA) dispensation with its chief Earnest Mawrie accusing it of anomalies in governance.rr

item.title: UP cops hunt for clues into case of college girl found with burn injuries
item.description: rrShahjahanpur’s superintendent of police S Anand, SP, denied reports that the girl was burnt after a failed rape attemptrr

item.title: Expert team widens mouth of lake formed upstream Rishiganga for faster drainage
item.description: rrAn expert team is trying to drain out the lake to prevent another tragedy like the Chamoli flash flood.rr

item.title: Amid Covid-19 fears, thousands throng Telangana’s Sammakka-Saralamma festival
item.description: rrThe tribal fair draws devotees not only from Telangana, but also from other states like Andhra Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Maharashtra and Madhya Pradesh.rr

item.title: Covid-19: West Bengal makes RT-PCR tests mandatory for arrivals from Maharashtra, 3 other states
item.description: rrThe notice released by the state government stated “All passengers coming to West Bengal from the aforementioned 4 states shall mandatorily carry a covid negative RT-PCR report for such test conducted within 72 hours of flight departure.”rr

item.title: 2 terrorists killed in encounter in Jammu and Kashmir’ Anantnag
item.description: rrThe police said they were ascertaining the identities and affiliation of the two terrorists.rr

item.title: Lives lost to wildlife-human conflict inadequately compensated in India: Study
item.description: rrThe research says the average compensation paid for human death in the country is r₹r1,91,437, and the average compensation paid for injury is r₹r6,185.rr

item.title: News updates from HT: Railways ministry clarifies on fare hike and all the latest news
item.description: Here are today’s top news, analysis and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.

item.title: India rejects Pakistan's criticism of human rights situation in Kashmir at UNHRC
item.description: rrIndia’s “right of reply” to the Pakistani minister’s speech was delivered by Seema Pujani, second secretary in the permanent mission to the UN.rr

item.title: Odisha MLA arrested in job scam gets bail, but will remain in jail
item.description: rrDespite the bail, Pradeep Panigrahy will not be released from prison as three other cases of fraud have been filed by the people of Ganjam district. rr

item.title: India's foodgrain output to rise 2% in 2020-21: Govt
item.description: In the 2019-20 crop year, the country's foograin output (comprising wheat, rice, pulses and coarse cereals) stood at a record 297.5 million tonnes (MT).

item.title: PM Modi bats for privatisation, says money earned will be used for people's welfare
item.description: rrReiterating his government’s stance on privatisation, the Prime Minister said, “We have made it clear in the new public sector enterprise policy that government will have limited role in only four strategic sectors and all other public sector units can be privatised.”rr

item.title: Cyberabad cops bust racket in Telangana after fraudulent issue of 72 passports
item.description: rrCyberabad police have arrested eight people in the passport scam, including two policemen who were responsible for verifying applications.rr

item.title: Tamil Nadu IPS officer accuses colleague of sexual harassment, inquiry ordered
item.description: The IPS officer accused of sexual harassment has been placed under 'compulsory wait' and a committee constituted to inquire into allegations levelled by the woman IPS officer.

item.title: 'TDP-sponsored': BJP on hurling of footwear at party leader during TV debate
item.description: The debate on the state cabinet's decision to extend government guarantee for raising Rs3,000 crore from banks for taking up Amaravati projects was aired on Telugu news channel ABN Andhrajyothi.

item.title: After court rap over Disha's arrest, Delhi Police chief explains intent
item.description: Ravi was arrested on the charges of sedition for allegedly sharing a 'toolkit' - a Google document - in favour of the ongoing farmers' protest.

item.title: Railways ministry clarifies on fare hike: 'Aim to prevent crowding during Covid'
item.description: The railways said that they aim to constantly increase the number of passenger trains in a phased manner. Regular trains had been stopped on March 22 last year after the nationwide lockdown was imposed to counter the spread of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Uttarakhand becomes fourth state with women’s police commando unit
item.description: rrThe 22 women commandos have been trained in rock climbing, counter-terrorism, bomb disposal, unarmed combat and others.rr

item.title: ‘De-escalation in Ladakh still a long way off’: General Naravane
item.description: The disengagement will be phased, coordinated and verified at all friction points. The first round of disengagement at Pangong Tso involved pulling back troops deployed eyeball-to-eyeball on the Finger 4 ridgeline and withdrawing soldiers holding positions on the Kailash range on the south bank.

item.title: Assam Congress collects over 1 lakh ‘gamosas’ with anti-CAA message
item.description: rrThe Congress has declared that it won’t allow imposition of the legislation, which eases rules of citizenship for religious minorities from Muslim-majority nations Bangladesh, Pakistan and Afghanistan, in the state if it comes to power.rr

item.title: As Centre announces phase 2 of Covid-19 vaccination, Odisha releases 'operational strategy'
item.description: rrThis announcement comes as the Centre is all set to start the second phase of Covid-19 vaccination from March 1.rr

item.title: AAP is challenge for Congress in Gujarat: CM Vijay Rupani
item.description: The AAP, which bagged 27 seats in Surat city in the February 21 civic elections, will not have any success in the coming polls to municipalities and district panchayats in the state, he claimed.

item.title: Ahead of polls, Assam declared ‘disturbed area’ under AFSPA by Governor
item.description: rrConsidered a draconian legislation by some, AFSPA allows security forces to conduct search operations and arrest anyone without any warrant. The provisions of AFSPA are applicable only to seven states in the northeast.rr

item.title: On India-China LAC row, Army chief says 'nobody wants an unsettled border'
item.description: The Army chief also said that India's engagements with China should continue as they have in the past and said that nobody wants an unsettled border, reported news agency ANI.

item.title: Uttarakhand CM back from Delhi, buzz around cabinet expansion grows
item.description: CM Rawat met home minister Amit Shah, defence minister Rajnath Singh and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, among other senior party leaders, during his Delhi visit.

item.title: Karnataka puts on hold mandatory RT-PCR rule for commuters from Kerala
item.description: rrThe interdependence between Kerala’s Kasaragod and Dakshina Kannada’s district headquarters Mangaluru has fuelled resistance to travel restrictions.rr

item.title: Only Motera stadium renamed after PM, complex continues to have Sardar Patel name: Govt
item.description: Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, who was present alongside Javadekar at the media briefing after a cabinet meeting, also took a swipe at the Congress leaders, asking whether party chief Sonia Gandhi or Rahul Gandhi have so far praised the world's tallest statue of Sardar Patel erected at Kevadiya in Gujarat.

item.title: Rajasthan to have separate agriculture budget from next year: Ashok Gehlot
item.description: The CM also announced setting up of a new Electricity Distribution Company for agriculture.

item.title: Bird flu confirmed in Maharashtra’s Palghar, says deputy collector
item.description: rrBird flu has been confirmed in Palghar, Maharashtra, on Wednesday, after 45 chickens died on Wednesday at a poultry farmrr

item.title: Farmers union writes to President demanding end to 'repression' on protesters
item.description: According to a press note, several other associated organisations also took up the taluka and district-level protests in hundreds of locations across the country to submit the memorandum to the President.

item.title: Uttarakhand responds to PIL against mining riverbed material on private lands
item.description: rrIn August last year the Uttarakhand High Court had stayed the state government' notification of allowing mining of riverbed material (RBM) on private lands adjacent to the rivers in the state.rr

item.title: Uttar Pradesh passes contentious bill prohibiting conversion from one religion to another by marriage
item.description: This bill will replace an ordinance which was already in place. The bill will now be sent to upper house of the state legislature and later to the Governor for his nod after which it will become act.

item.title: Phase 2 of Covid-19 vaccination from March 1: When will you get the shot?
item.description: India's tally of infections stands at over 11.03 million, as it recorded 13,742 new cases of the coronavirus disease, Union health ministry data shows.

item.title: 'To vaccinate people free of cost': Mamata seeks PM's help in procuring Covid vaccine
item.description: In her letter to PM Modi, the West Bengal chief minister has urged the matter to be alleviated to top authorities seeking the purchase of the vaccines "from designated points on top priority in order to provide vaccine free of cost to the people."

item.title: Covid-19 vaccine at private centres to be expensive? AIIMS director explains
item.description: Following the announcement, All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) director Randeep Guleria said, the private vaccination centres "will allow people to come and get vaccinated the way they feel comfortable.

item.title: Union Cabinet approves President’s Rule in Puducherry
item.description: The Congress government was reduced to a minority after five of its MLAs and one from ally Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam resigned. The chief minister resigned after failing the floor test

item.title: Threatened by MP police for pulling them up for inaction in murder case: Judge
item.description: Judge RP Sonkar alleged the police were maligning his image. He wrote to the sessions judge two days after a police officer accused him of harassing and insulting her for the delay in Govind Singh’s arrest

item.title: 'Expect most ministers to pay for their Covid vaccines': Ravi Shankar Prasad
item.description: As many as 20,000 private hospitals and 10,000 government centres will be rendering their services in the second round of the Covid-19 vaccination programme.

item.title: 'Set on fire after failed gang rape attempt,' says UP college student
item.description: According to Superintendent of Police S Anand, the girl told investigators that three people tried to rape her in a field near Rai Kheda village on Monday and when they did not succeed, they poured kerosene and set her on fire.

item.title: President's rule in Puducherry to vaccination drive: Key highlights of Cabinet meet
item.description: rrFrom announcing the next phase of Covid-19 vaccination drive to approving President's rule in Puducherry, the ministers announced the Centre's new policy moves and administrative decisions.rr

item.title: News updates from HT: Kejriwal lauds AAP’s performance in Gujarat civic polls and all the latest news
item.description: Here are today’s top news, analysis and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.

item.title: '125-year-old Congress defeated': Arvind Kejriwal on AAP's performance in Gujarat civic polls
item.description: The Delhi chief minister and AAP chief said he will be visiting Surat on February 36, where his party has won 27 seats. Kejriwal also said that a new type of politics has emerged from Gujarat - the politics of honesty.

item.title: Bihar policeman, criminal killed in encounter in Sitamarhi
item.description: rrEyewitnesses said the police team came under a hail of fire when they went to the house of a criminal to arrest him.rr

item.title: Govt to decide Covid-19 vaccine price in pvt hospitals soon: Minister
item.description: Javadekar said the proposal was approved at a meeting of the Union cabinet, which was chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

item.title: Motera stadium renamed Narendra Modi Stadium; President Kovind inaugurates venue
item.description: On this day last year, the stadium, which can accommodate 110,000 spectators, was the venue for PM Modi’s mega rally with then US President Donald Trump

item.title: Cabinet approves President's Rule in Puducherry
item.description: Announcing the Cabinet decision, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar told reporters that the decision was taken as no party claimed to form a government in Puducherry following the resignation of the chief minister there.

item.title: BJP will get befitting reply for 'subverting' mandate in Puducherry: Moily
item.description: In an interview with PTI, Moily claimed the Puducherry polls will mark the "beginning of the fall of the BJP" in the country and the strengthening of democratic power through the Congress party.

item.title: Covid-19: Hotels, eateries to stay shut in Nagpur on weekends
item.description: Nagpur has recorded 1,44,534 Covid-19 cases, including 4,291 casualties and 1,33,775 recoveries. As on Tuesday, the district had 6,468 active cases.

item.title: Goa: Union minister Shripad Naik discharged from hospital
item.description: Naik suffered multiple fractures and other injuries in an accident at Akola, where he was on a trip with his wife and personal staff. While Naik survived with serious injuries, his wife and one member of his staff died

item.title: ‘Ready to discuss’: Tomar reacts to Tikait's remark about 40 lakh tractor march
item.description: “The government of India is committed to double farmers' income and work towards agriculture's welfare. Discussions have been held many times. If they have a point to raise even now, we are ready to discuss,” Tomar said.

item.title: Cabinet clears phase 2 of Covid vaccination from March 1; those with comorbidities can go to govt, private hospitals
item.description: The government has been ramping up the existing nationwide vaccination drive, which began on January 16, to start the next phase of inoculation.

item.title: 5 top-performing states under PM-Kisan scheme
item.description: rrIn terms of the highest number of beneficiaries authenticated under the PM-Kisan scheme, Karnataka emerged as the winner with 97 per cent authentication.rr

item.title: 'Dream of PM Modi': Amit Shah at inauguration of Motera cricket stadium
item.description: Spread over 63 acres, the Motera stadium has been built at an estimated cost of r₹r800 crore. It has 11 pitches made of both red and black soil and is the only stadium in the world to have same soil surfaces for the main and practice pitches.

item.title: PM’s vision to build largest stadium in Ahmedabad: Amit Shah as Motera stadium renamed Narendra Modi stadium
item.description: The Narendra Modi Stadium, which President Kovind said is an example of eco-friendly development, can accommodate 132,000 spectators.

item.title: PM-Kisan scheme completes 2 years: All you need to know
item.description: The scheme was formally launched on February 24, 2019, with the aim to augment the income of the farmers by providing income support to all landholding farmers’ families across the country.

item.title: President Ram Nath Kovind inaugurates world's largest Motera cricket stadium: All you need to know
item.description: The stadium is hosting a match between India and England today. On February 24, 2019, the then President of United States, Donald Trump had visited Motera Stadium for the 'Namaste Trump' event.

item.title: 2 terrorists killed in encounter in J-K’s Anantnag
item.description: The area has now been cordoned off as the encounter is still underway. The identity of the dead terrorists is yet to be ascertained.

item.title: Palghar lynching case: SC asks Maharashtra Police to place fresh charge sheet on record
item.description: A bench of Justices Ashok Bhushan and R S Reddy was informed by the counsel for the Maharashtra government that a second supplementary charge sheet has been filed in the case.

item.title: Odisha enhances incentive for marrying person with disabilities to r₹r2.5 lakh
item.description: The incentive amount under the scheme has now been enhanced from r₹r50,000 to r₹r2,50,000 per eligible couple, Bhaskar Sharma, commissioner-cum-secretary of SSEPD wrote.

item.title: Disha Ravi gets bail in toolkit case: Key points of the order
item.description: Additional sessions judge Dharmender Rana cited the distinction between sedition and dissent and questioned if Ravi and others were being targeted because they voiced opposition to the farm laws

item.title: Not wearing masks in Mumbai won't cost r₹r1,000, police chief busts fake news
item.description: Criminal proceeding or fine or both will be initiated against miscreants spreading misinformation on social media, Mumbai Police said.

item.title: HC allows home quarantine for Covid-19 negative family after returning from UK
item.description: The central government said its guidelines only mandate 14-days home quarantine for travellers from the UK if they test negative and institutional quarantine is not advised.

item.title: Sonia Gandhi appoints leaders to discuss seat sharing with DMK: Report
item.description: Elections are likely to be held for the 234-member Tamil Nadu assembly in April-May this year.

item.title: All you need to know about MHA’s 'Ayushman CAPF' scheme
item.description: The scheme is a joint initiative by the ministry of home affairs and the national health authority. The purpose of the scheme is to provide cashless health services to the CAPF personnel and their dependents using the Ayushman Bharat PM-JAY IT platform.

item.title: Union minister Shripad Naik discharged from Goa hospital
item.description: Naik was admitted to the GMCH on January 12 after he met with an accident, in which his wife and an aide were killed.

item.title: 19 states, UTs reported no Covid-19 deaths in past 24 hours: Health ministry
item.description: The ministry also confirmed that 104 deaths were recorded across India within the same time frame and five states account for nearly 82 per cent of these fatalities.

item.title: Idea of climate action should not be to move climate ambition goal post to 2050: India at UNSC
item.description: The year 2050 is when nations have been called on to achieve net-zero CO2 emissions.

item.title: Covid-19: Maharashtra’s Jalna orders shutdown of schools, colleges, weekly markets till March 31
item.description: “Jalna district collector has ordered to shut schools, colleges, coaching classes and weekly markets in the district till March 31, due to current Covid-19 situation," superintendent of police V Deshmukh said.

item.title: Rajasthan CM announces state’s first paperless budget. Here are some highlights
item.description: While the budget speech by the chief minister, who holds the finance portfolio, is still going on here are key announcements made till now.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi's 'spiteful, vile' politics based on lies: Smriti Irani
item.description: Smriti Irani said Gandhi has established defeat for his party through his lies, further alleging that he disassociates himself from the truth and continuously propagates lies to insult the intelligence of citizens across the country.

item.title: India's Anjali Bhardwaj among 12 recipients of US anticorruption champion award
item.description: rrBlinken said the winners of the award inspire us and so many of their counterparts pursuing these ideals around the world.rr

item.title: Gujarat municipal polls: Failure of Congress, not emergence of AAP, says BJP
item.description: However, there are concerns that the AAP could stoke issues that have been weak spots for the BJP, such as the Patidar movement that sought to bring the community under the ambit of the OBC quota

item.title: Kerala withdraws cases against Sabarimala and citizenship law protesters
item.description: While the Congress lauded the decision, the BJP said the temple issue should not be conflated with the citizenship law protests.

item.title: Hyderabad pharmacy student who mislead police, dies by suicide
item.description: rrThe police had concluded that there was no connection between the girl's account and the technical evidence gathered in the case.rr

item.title: Court seeks police response on Shantanu Muluk's anticipatory bail plea
item.description: During the brief hearing held through video-conferencing on Wednesday, the court also noted that Muluk has been granted protection from arrest till February 26.

item.title: News updates from HT: Expert panel to decide on Sputnik V vaccine approval today and all the latest news
item.description: rrHere are today’s top news, analysis, and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.rr

item.title: Toolkit case: 'Justice has been done,' says father after Disha Ravi’s bail
item.description: "We are not connected with anybody. We are only asking this basic question about the climate. I am an Indian, we have to respect the nation's rules and regulations," he also said.

item.title: Odisha: Six elephants die of haemorrhagic septicemia
item.description: Investigation of samples of six dead elephants and a dead cow in the sanctuary has revealed the cause of death to be haemorrhagic septicaemia caused by the bacteria Pasteurella multocida

item.title: On PM-Kisan's 2nd anniversary, Modi says govt doing to double farmers' income
item.description: In a series of tweets, the Prime Minister said his government has the "honour of ushering a historic increase in minimum support price (MSP)" for procurement of crops.

item.title: J&K L-G asks visiting tourists to be UT’s goodwill ambassadors
item.description: L-G Manoj Sinha also assured the tourists a safe and pleasant visit and added that the tourism department, the local community, and other stakeholders were collectively making the environment tourist-friendly

item.title: What led to Covid-19 rise? Centre deputes teams to 10 states for probe
item.description: These teams will work with the state/UT administration and ascertain the reasons for the recent surge in the number of cases.

item.title: Kerala to withdraw cases filed during Sabarimala agitation, anti-CAA protests
item.description: More than 50,000 people were booked in connection with the agitation.

item.title: Five new job surveys to help gather data for national employment policy
item.description: The surveys will begin in April and will take about six months to complete. They will offer a segmented view of the jobs’ economy, focusing on data that have largely been missing

item.title: Code of ethics: What OTT platforms, such as Netflix and Hotstar, may have to follow
item.description: The code is likely to mandate intermediaries and online curated content companies to exercise “due caution and discretion” while airing content that may impact India’s sovereignty and integrity, threaten or jeopardise the state’s security and be detrimental to the country’s foreign relations

item.title: UPSC exam: SC says no extra chance for those who exhausted last attempt in 2020
item.description: The petitioners, some of whom were frontline workers during Covid-19, had exhausted their last attempt at the examination held last year amid the pandemic

item.title: r₹r5,000 crore annual loss to Western Railway due to Covid-19 crisis: Official
item.description: Many people are still reluctant to travel by train due to fear of the coronavirus, Western Railway's General Manager Alok Kansal told reporters here on Tuesday.

item.title: Sputnik V to get approval in India? Expert committee meet today
item.description: If the expert committee gives its nod, then the application will be forwarded to the Drug Controller General of India (DCGI) for final approval.

item.title: Aspirants who exhausted last UPSC prelims attempt in 2020 can’t appear again: Supreme Court
item.description: UPSC exams: The Centre was initially not willing to concede to giving an extra chance but it was later done at the suggestion of the bench.

item.title: Rift in BJP-IPFT pact in Tripura ahead of tribal areas district council polls
item.description: rrThe TTAADC has 30 seats of which 28 are elected and two are nominated. It covers nearly 68% of Tripura.rr

item.title: Chhattisgarh orders Covid screening and contact tracing of all visitors
item.description: rrAll the commissioners and district collectors have been directed to ensure strict adherence to the latest instructions.rr

item.title: 98 CPI members join BJP ahead of Assembly polls in Kerala
item.description: Recently, Former Delhi Metro chief E Sreedharan joined BJP ahead of Assembly polls in Kerala.

item.title: States told to expedite Covid vaccination drive: What prompted govt's action
item.description: The moves come as alarm grows over what looks like the beginning of India’s second wave of infections, underscoring the need to scale up the vaccination process

item.title: IMA's remark 'uncalled for': Patanjali backs Harsh Vardhan in Coronil row
item.description: Patanjali said the health minister never undermined modern medicine and hence IMA's criticism was 'appalling'.

item.title: ECI to hold meeting to finalise upcoming Assembly elections of 5 states tomorrow
item.description: The terms of the legislative assemblies of five poll-bound states -- West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Assam, Kerala, and Puducherry are will come to an end either in May or in June this year.

item.title: India records 13,742 fresh Covid-19 infections, daily toll again crosses 100
item.description: The daily toll on Wednesday shot up to 104 after only 78 new Covid-19 fatalities were reported on Tuesday.

item.title: SSB to use image analysis at Nepal, Bhutan borders to monitor changes, troops
item.description: The move comes months after Nepal redrew its political map laying claim over strategically key areas, while India and China, this month, began disengagement of troops after an 8-month standoff

item.title: Who is Kiran Ahuja, Biden's choice for the US Office of Personnel Management?
item.description: The United States Office of Personnel Management is a federal agency that manages US civilian services.

item.title: Travellers from 5 states need negative Covid-19 report to enter Delhi from Feb 26 till March 15
item.description: Along with Maharashtra, Kerala, Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh and Punjab have also seen a surge in daily cases, according to the Union ministry of health and family welfare.

item.title: Disha Ravi gets bail in toolkit case: What the court said
item.description: Additional sessions judge Dharmender Rana released the 22-year-old activist on a personal bond of r₹r1 lakh and two sureties of similar amounts

item.title: Delhi medical body condemns letter criticising health min for Coronil launch
item.description: The DMA said the questions being raised by IMA regarding the nature of the trial of Coronil or on false claims of WHO certification are to be answered by the drug Controller or Patanjali Research Institute

item.title: Former BJD MLA arrested for assaulting and robbing tourists
item.description: rrThis is not the first arrest for the former BJD MLA, in October 2018, he was arrested in Andhra Pradesh for misbehaving with a girl and her mother.rr

item.title: Delhi, Punjab, Chhattisgarh: List of state-wise curbs amid Covid-19
item.description: Jalna of Aurangabad district in Maharashtra has closed educational institutions till March 31. A decision on reducing occupancy in cinema halls in Punjab will be taken after March 1.

item.title: Highlights: False narrative that farmers will lose land: Union minister
item.description: Rakesh Tikait, leader and national spokesperson of the Bharatiya Kisan Union, said on Tuesday that the protesting farmers would gherao Parliament, if the Central government does not repeal the three laws, during his address to a Kisan Panchayat in Sikar, Rajasthan.

item.title: News updates from HT: Indian firms likely to give average salary hike of 7.7% and all the latest news
item.description: Here are today’s top news, analysis, and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.

item.title: Chhattisgarh woman Maoist surrendered last week, dies by suicide, probe sought
item.description: rrThe deceased, Kawasi, was a member of Chetna Natya Mandli or CNM, which is a cultural wing of the Maoists.rr

item.title: Govt steps up vaccination drive amid fresh Covid-19 spike; over 11.9 million doses administered
item.description: The government plans to take the rate of coronavirus vaccinations to five million a day in the next four to six weeks.

item.title: SC to hear plea seeking CBI probe in Palghar mob-lynching case
item.description: The pleas also seek a probe by the CBI and registration of FIR against police officials for their alleged failure to prevent the mob from gathering in violation of the lockdown norms.

item.title: Anganwadi centres reopen after 11 months in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri
item.description: Anganwadi workers tried their best to provide door to door facilities to the people during lockdown. Many workers provided cooked meals as well while adhering to Covid-19 protocols.

item.title: Karnataka HC imposes r₹r10 lakh cost on company for petitions against Azim Premji
item.description: Despite the dismissal of earlier petitions, the petitioner filed fresh writ petitions with the same core issue.

item.title: Rain, snow warning for J&K, Himachal, Uttarakhand for next five days
item.description: Thunderstorms and lightning are very likely over Jammu, Kashmir, Ladakh, Gilgit, Baltistan & Muzaffarabad, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand between February 25 and 27

item.title: 16 people injured as TDP, YSRCP workers clash in Srikakulam, Andhra Pradesh
item.description: Sub Inspector of Srikakulam Police M Ahmad said, "A clash erupted between workers of TDP and YSRCP in Mettavalasa village of Srikakulam allegedly over social media post related to recent local body polls."

item.title: Maharashtra Covid-19: Record spike in Amravati, districts impose travel ban
item.description: Parbhani of the Marathwada region of Maharashtra, famous for Sai Baba temple, has announced the closure of places of worship and imposed travel restrictions from the 11 districts of Vidarbha.

item.title: White House nominates Indian-American as director of management and budget
item.description: If confirmed by the Senate, 50-year-old Tanden would become the first person of colour to head the federal agency that prepares the annual budget of the US government.

item.title: 7 killed as oil tanker collides with car on Yamuna Expressway
item.description: During the collision, a car came between the tanker and the divider. All those who were travelling in the car are dead.

item.title: Highlights: Covid variants risk third virus wave, says German chancellor Merkel
item.description: Citizens above 60 and 45 years of age with co-morbidities will be vaccinated in government and private hospitals from Monday, the Cabinet has decided. Those opting for government clinics will be vaccinated for free.

item.title: 1,040 militants of 5 outfits surrender in Assam
item.description: The militants deposited 338 arms, including 58 AK series rifles, 11 M-16 guns and four LMGs.

item.title: Biden nominates Indian-American lawyer Kiran Ahuja to head Office of Personnel Management
item.description: Ahuja currently serves as Chief Executive Officer of Philanthropy Northwest, a regional network of philanthropic institutions.

item.title: Punjab: Out of 4,000 schoolteachers tested, 13 found positive for Covid-19
item.description: Amid the growing concern over the rising Covid-19 trend in the state, Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Tuesday ordered fresh restrictions on indoor gathering to 100.

item.title: Indian social activist among 12 anti-corruption champions awarded by Biden admin
item.description: According to the State Department, Bhardwaj has served as an active member of the Right to Information Movement in India for over two decades.

item.title: TN mining baron jailed for bribing official
item.description: A fine of r₹r10 lakh was also imposed on Vaikundarajan’s company, VV Minerals, for trying to fraudulently get approval for the terms of reference, which are considered in-principle approval for a project.

item.title: China needs to do more to restore normalcy: Officials
item.description: China’s next steps will be watched closely to decide on the future course of engagement either at the bilateral or multilateral level, the people said on condition of anonymity.

item.title: AAP springs a surprise, Kejriwal thanks voters
item.description: The BJP appeared headed to win all six municipal corporations-- Ahmedabad, Vadodara, Bhavnagar, Jamnagar, Rajkot and Surat.

item.title: ‘Your Honour’ suitable for US, magistrate courts, says CJI
item.description: CJI Bobde, heading a three-judge bench, was hearing a petition filed by law student Shrikant Prasad. The petition sought filling up of vacancies in the subordinate judiciary, in particular at courts handling criminal cases.

item.title: Militant leader gives up arms in Guwahati
item.description: Welcoming the militants to the mainstream, Assam chief minister Sarbananda Sonowal said, “I welcome all of you to the mainstream after giving up arms. We must all work together towards a peaceful and prosperous Assam. The government would do all it can to ensure that you are rehabilitated well.”

item.title: Trust in country’s health sector increased during pandemic: PM
item.description: The prestige of India’s health sector and trust in it has increased manifold across the globe after it successfully overcame the “trial by fire” during the Covid-19 pandemic, he added, addressing a webinar on effective implementation of the Union Budget’s provisions in the health sector.

item.title: Custody not a substitute for conviction: Top court
item.description: A bench of justices Sanjay Kishan Kaul and Hrishikesh Roy was critical of the “new philosophy” applied by the police and the prosecution to try and keep people in jail at least for a few days as a form of punishment prior to proving their guilt.

item.title: Rahul’s remark triggers ‘north-south’ row
item.description: Gandhi, while speaking at the concluding rally of the ‘Aishwarya Yatra’, led by the leader of Opposition in the Kerala assembly, Ramesh Chennithala, said he learnt a lot from Kerala and understood a bit about the “wisdom of the people” here.

item.title: Modi calls for home-grown tech solutions
item.description: “The scenario has changed in India in the 21st century. The needs and aspirations of the nation have also changed. Not just Indian Institutes of Technology, IITs must take it to the next level to indigenous institutes of technology,” Modi told students of India’s oldest IIT.

item.title: Draft govt policy seeks 3-tier checks for OTTs
item.description: In the document, titled Information Technology (Guidelines for Intermediaries and Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021, the government cites powers provided to it under section 87 of the Information Technology Act, 2000

item.title: Mutations of Sars-Cov-2 found in Maharashtra, Kerala samples: Officials
item.description: Health experts say that there is no direct relation between the mutations and the spike in Covid cases in the two states.

item.title: A race against time: Vaccine drive needs boost amid spike
item.description: Data shows that the seven-day average of new cases across India dropped to its lowest on February 11, when it touched 10,988, but it has shown a sustained increase since then to reach 12,971 on Monday – a rise of 18%.

item.title: ‘Honoured to serve Gujarat’: Modi after civic polls sweep
item.description: The BJP has bagged 489 seats from a total of 576, as many as 100 more than the 389 seats it won out of 572 in the 2015 elections to the municipal corporations of Ahmedabad, Jamnagar, Bhavnagar, Surat, Rajkot and Vadodara.

item.title: ‘Sketchy evidence’: Disha granted bail
item.description: The judge held that Ravi had no connection with pro-Khalistani organisations, Poetic Justice Foundation (PJF) and Sikhs for Justice, and that there was not an “iota” of evidence linking her to the violence that rocked Delhi on Republic Day.

item.title: Rakesh Tikait holds out threat of Parliament siege if farm laws are not repealed
item.description: rrBKU leader Rakesh Tikait said the farmers' fight will continue unless a new law on MSP is made and three farm law are rolled back.rr

item.title: Tears and smiles as Ravi makes bail after 10 days
item.description: Elated at the court order, Ravi had tears in her eyes as her lawyers ran from one court to another to complete the formalities of her release.

item.title: 4 school students killed, 6 injured in Bihar as bus rams SUV
item.description: rrAngry locals blocked the road, burnt the bus and chased away police team which allegedly reached the site of the accident late. rr

item.title: Cong may focus on MSMEs before TN, Bengal polls
item.description: In January and February, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s public engagements — both virtual and in the field —have been dominated by concerns for the MSME sector.

item.title: 'Divisive mentality': Shivraj Singh on Rahul Gandhi's north-south remark
item.description: Chouhan was speaking about a remark made by Gandhi in Thiruvananthapuram where he was talking about his experience in a different type of politics.

item.title: Union Minister Shripad Naik to be discharged from hospital on February 24
item.description: According to a statement by his office issued on Monday, "Union Minister Shripad Naik will be discharged from Goa Medical College Hospital, Bambolim on February 24."

item.title: Rahul Gandhi says BJP going soft on Left Front leaders under probe in Kerala
item.description: rrRahul Gandhi also accused the Left Front government in Kerala of nepotism that ensured jobs are reserved only for its sympathisers and workers in Kerala.rr

item.title: Covid-19: Night curfew imposed in Maharashtra's Aurangabad till March 8
item.description: "It has been decided that curfew to remain imposed from 11 pm-6 am from February 23 to March 8. Essential services are exempted," said Nikhil Gupta, Aurangabad Police Commissioner.

item.title: ‘Take Covid vaccine or else…’, Odisha warns healthcare and frontline workers
item.description: rrThe government warned healthcare and frontline workers who are reluctant to take the vaccine that their privileges would be taken away if they do not comply with the vaccination drive. rr

item.title: Congress, SDA allies in Puducherry to stage demonstration against Centre
item.description: Leaders of the Congress and other parties affiliated to the Secular Democratic Alliance (SDA) in the union territory would take part in the protest.

item.title: Priyanka Gandhi's speech in Mathura interrupted after protest over rape case in Rajasthan
item.description: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra addressed the Kisan Panchayat in Mathura - one of the several the Congress party plans to organise in 28 districts of the state to raise a voice against the farm laws and to support farmers' demand to repeal them.

item.title: Climate activist Disha Ravi released from Tihar jail
item.description: “Disha was released after jail authorities completed all formalities regarding her release,” official said.

item.title: Government wants no dissent at all: CPI(M) on completion of one year of Delhi riots
item.description: Speaking on the completion of a year since the northeast Delhi riots, Brinda Karat alleged that "there has been a deliberate subversion of justice as truth has been hijacked to serve political interests and save BJP leaders".

item.title: Assam militant wanted for multiple killings returns from Myanmar to surrender
item.description: rrIngti Kathar Songbijit and 1,039 other militants belonging to five rebel groups surrendered in front of chief minister Sarbananda Sonowal at a function in Guwahati.rr

item.title: 'Divide and rule politics won't work': Nadda uses Gujarat civic poll results to take a jibe at Rahul Gandhi
item.description: A host of BJP leaders will visit poll-bound Kerala to partake in the 'Vijaya Yatra' rally, which was flagged off by Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath earlier this week. Rahul Gandhi too is in Kerala on a two-day visit.

item.title: Indian Railways to run 11 new special trains. Here is full list
item.description: The Railways took this decision in order to ease the traffic on specific routes.

item.title: News updates from HT: CJI asks petitioner to not address Supreme Court judges as 'Your Honour' and all the latest news
item.description: Here are today’s top news, analysis and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.

item.title: Centre signs $304 million pact with AIIB for power transmission network in Assam
item.description: According to an official release here, the fund will be utilised for the 'Assam Intra-State Transmission System Enhancement Project', aiming to improve reliability, capacity and security of the power transmission network in the state.

item.title: Protest in Odisha assembly against fuel price hike
item.description: Odisha Finance Minister Niranjan Pujari said the tax collected on fuel by the state government is utilised for the welfare of poor people.

item.title: More pvt hospitals to be utilised for increasing vaccination coverage: Govt
item.description: Responding to a query during a press briefing here, Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan said out of 10,000 hospitals being used for administering the vaccines in a day, 2,000 hospitals are private.

item.title: Don’t address Supreme Court judges as ‘Your Honour’: CJI to petitioner
item.description: This is the second instance when CJI Bobde has spoken out against the use of “Your Honour”.

item.title: India’s hasn’t changed its mind on Chinese investment, will make no exceptions: Officials
item.description: India will continue to closely watch China’s next steps along the Line of Actual Control and will not rush to lift restrictions on investments from Bejing

item.title: MoD clears defence buys worth r₹r13,700 cr, including 118 Arjun Mk-1A tanks
item.description: rrThe order for the tanks could be placed with the Ordnance Factory Board (OFB) this year, with five tanks to be delivered within 30 months of the signing of the contract.rr

item.title: Maharashtra home minister Anil Deshmukh says sale of Patanjali's Coronil without certification will not be allowed
item.description: Deshmukh said on Twitter that it was "highly deplorable" that two senior Union ministers endorsed the drug.

item.title: Government says 2 new variants not behind Covid-19 surge in Maharashtra, Kerala
item.description: NITI Aayog Member (Health) V K Paul said that 187 people have tested positive for the UK strain of SARS-CoV-2 in the country so far, while six people have detected with the South Africa variant. Also, one person has tested positive for the Brazil variant strain.

item.title: India commences supply of Covid-19 vaccines to Africa under Covax facility
item.description: "Fulfilling our commitment to help the world with Covid-19 vaccines, supplies of Made in India vaccine commence today for Africa under Covax facility," Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) spokesperson Anurag Srivastava tweeted.

item.title: Mumbai's daily Covid-19 infection tally falls to 643, Maha witnesses spike
item.description: rrMaharashtra witnessed a slight increase in the tally of daily infections on Tuesday.rr

item.title: After Savitri, Maharaj becomes second leopard at SGNP to get radio collar
item.description: rrThe exercise is part of the first phase of leopard radio-collaring work being carried out at SGNP to track and understand the animal’s movementrr

item.title: India allows use of airspace by Pakistan PM Imran Khan's special aircraft
item.description: rrIndia’s decision to allow the special flight to use its airspace was in marked contrast to Pakistan’s actions in 2019, when Islamabad denied permission for the use of Pakistani airspace by three Indian VVIP flights.rr

item.title: ‘Doosri Indira Gandhi’: Priyanka greeted by supporters in Vrindavan in video shared by Congress
item.description: The incident occurred on Tuesday during Gandhi's visit to the Banke Bihari temple in the city, a video of which was shared by the Congress on its social media handle.

item.title: BJP set to sweep Gujarat civic polls; PM Modi tweets thank you, Amit Shah calls it 'one of the best results'
item.description: Chief minister Vijay Rupani and his deputy Nitin Patel had earlier expressed gratitude to the voters and BJP workers for Gujarat municipal election results. The counting is being held in six municipal corporations in the state.

item.title: Toolkit didn’t call for violence, says judge who ordered Disha Ravi release
item.description: rrDelhi judge Dharmender Rana's order said "the offence of sedition cannot be invoked to minister to the wounded vanity of the governments'.rr

item.title: Soldier dies, 2 others injured in freak mishap in firing range in J-K’s Akhnoor
item.description: rrDuring a live fire training, the barrel of a 105 mm gun suddenly burst and the flying splinters hit three soldiers, killing one of them.rr

item.title: Punjab: Curbs on gatherings from March 1; Covid testing to be ramped up
item.description: According to the new rules, the number of people allowed in indoor gatherings will be capped at 100, while for outdoor gatherings it will be kept at 200.

item.title: ‘My trust in judiciary has increased’, says Disha Ravi’s mother
item.description: rrDisha Ravi was arrested by the Delhi police from her residence in Bengaluru on February 13, following an FIR filed on February 4 charging her with sedition among other things.rr

item.title: In Disha Ravi case, judge cites Rig Veda: 'Our civilisation never been averse to ideas from varied quarters'
item.description: Disha Ravi was arrested from Bengaluru on February 13 and has spent six days under police custody and three under judicial remand.

item.title: Odisha Congress MLAs cycle to state assembly in protest against fuel prices
item.description: The price of petrol is currently the highest in Kalimela of Malkangiri, where it is being sold at r₹r97.45 per litre. In Bhubaneswar, it is being sold at r₹r91.64 per litre.

item.title: Anti-incumbency does not apply to Gujarat: Vijay Rupani amid lead in civic polls
item.description: Polling for elections to municipal corporations of Ahmedabad, Surat, Vadodara, Rajkot, Jamnagar and Bhavnagar was conducted on Sunday. These elections were being seen as a test for Rupani ahead of the assembly polls in the state next year.

item.title: MP govt hands over health centres to pvt medical college in Indore, sparks row
item.description: rrThe Madhya Pradesh government said that if the pilot project in Indore works, then it would hand over more primary and community health centres to private partners under PPP mode.rr

item.title: Tamil Nadu interim budget presented amid opposition walkout
item.description: During his budget speech, Panneerselvam urged the government of India to release all the performance grants due to Tamil Nadu based on the 14th Finance Commission recommendations without further delay

item.title: Red Fort violence: Deep Sidhu sent to 14-day judicial custody
item.description: Delhi court sends actor-activist Deep Sidhu, arrested in connection with Red Fort violence on Republic Day, to 14-day judicial custody, news agency PTI reported.

item.title: India's Covid-19 positivity rate declining, trend of less deaths seen: Govt
item.description: Officials said that India has inoculated at least 1.17 crore people — 1.04 crore have been administered first dose and 12.61 lakh second dose — across the country.

item.title: Kushinagar gets DGCA clearance, becomes third international airport in UP
item.description: In June last year, Centre had given its go ahead to upgrade the Kushinagar airport to an international one.

item.title: Kerala CM writes to PM Modi on Karnataka travel restriction
item.description: rrThe Karnataka government has reinstated stricter control for people coming from Kerala in view of increasing Covid-19 cases there.rr

item.description: Here is everything you need to know about the Intensified Mission Indradhanush, India's mission to achieve full immunization converage.

item.title: Terrorism one of the gravest threats to humankind: Jaishankar
item.description: In his virtual address to the high-level segment of the 46th session of the UN Human Rights Council, Jaishankar called for a coordinated global response to the challenges confronting the human rights agenda, including terrorism, global inequities and armed conflicts

item.title: Pak spouses of Kashmiri men protest in Srinagar, seek citizenship or deportation
item.description: rrThe protestors were demanding issuance of travel documents for their trip to their former homes.rr

item.title: India a victim of terrorism, leading global action against it: S Jaishankar
item.description: The foreign affairs minister also said that India has championed the global fight against terrorism having faced it as a long-standing victim.

item.title: Amid Covid-19 spike, Maharashtra minister defies Covid-19 norms
item.description: rrThe supporters also clashed with the police and security personnel had to use batons to disperse the crowd, the video showed.rr

item.title: Moments after Mamata Banerjee leaves, CBI team reaches Abhishek's house; wife questioned for an hour
item.description: The developments come months ahead of the assembly elections in the state with Trinamool Congress calling it political vendetta.

item.title: Lakha Sidhana, Jan 26 violence accused on run, spotted at farmers' rally in Punjab
item.description: Sidhana, who has been on the run since January 26, also gave a speech at the rally and said that the agitation called by the farmers will be intensified.

item.title: These states require a negative RT-PCR test for entry
item.description: Some states now require RT-PCR tests for visitors, especially those who are arriving by air, in an effort to limit the spread of new coronavirus variants.

item.title: Chhattisgarh: Peace panel formed for dialogue with Maoists and the state
item.description: rrThe committee will start meetings soon and will form district committees in each violence-affected district of the state.rr

item.title: Delhi judge finds police probe sketchy and scanty, grants bail to Disha Ravi
item.description: On Monday, she was sent to one-day police custody after a three-day judicial remand and spending five days in police custody. Ravi was arrested on February 13.

item.title: ‘Actor on tractor’: Union minister Pralhad Joshi questions Rahul Gandhi over APMC, farm law
item.description: The senior Bharatiya Janata Party leader’s remarks come a day after Gandhi held a tractor rally in his constituency in Kerala’s Wayanad against the Centre’s three new farm laws.

item.title: Fragmentation of tiger habitat is leading to inbreeding, low survival: Study
item.description: The study published in journal of Molecular Biology and Evolution published on February 16 suggests that there is inbreeding among Indian tigers, which is a result of isolated populations due to habitat loss

item.title: In bail plea, Nodeep Kaur claims she was 'beaten and tortured' by police
item.description: rrThe 23-year-old activist, hailing from Punjab's Muktsar district, has also claimed that her medical examination was not conducted in violation of section 54 of the Criminal Procedure Code.rr

item.title: Manipur: Passengers from Maharashtra, Kerala to be tested for Covid at airport
item.description: The northeastern state had decided to discontinue Covid-19 testing of incoming air passengers at the airport with effect from December 18 last year

item.title: PM Narendra Modi’s new mantra for IIT students: Self-Three
item.description: Addressing the 66th convocation of IIT Kharagpur in West Bengal virtually, Modi said that India can become a major player in the field of science, technology, research, and innovation

item.title: Focus on addressing global issues: PM Modi asks students at IIT Kharagpur
item.description: rrThe Prime Minister said that if IITs start addressing the problems India is currently facing then it will also gradually be able to address global issues.rr

item.title: Days after dip in Sangam, Priyanka Gandhi continues outreach in Nishad community
item.description: rrThe Nishad community is a caste group listed under Other Backward Classes in UP. Nishads are heavily dependent on the tourism industry as they ferry tourists in the famous ghats of Varanasi and Prayagraj.rr

item.title: Uttarakhand: Covid-19 test mandatory for people arriving from five states
item.description: rrThe decision was taken in face of a sudden rise in the number of Covid-19 cases in several states.rr

item.title: Toolkit case: Shantanu Muluk moves Delhi court for anticipatory bail
item.description: The application moved by Muluk is likely to come up for hearing Wednesday before Additional Sessions Judge Dharmender Rana.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal wants farmers to commit suicide, alleges BJP's Meenakshi Lekhi
item.description: "Kejriwal wants the farmer to keep committing suicide. The condition of the farmers continues to deteriorate. It is Kejriwal who speaks the language of middlemen," said Lekhi.

item.title: R-Day violence: Farmer leaders’ arrest triggers protests in Jammu
item.description: The Delhi Police arrested the two late on Monday for their alleged involvement in the January 26 violence at Delhi’s Red Fort during the tractor rally organised as part of protests against the three farm laws
